Title: Relates to the disclosure of special care offered to persons with Alzheimer's disease or dementia
Summary: Makes provisions relating to the disclosure of special care offered to persons with Alzheimer's disease or dementia; requires any facility that offers, advertises, markets or otherwise promotes itself as providing Alzheimer's and dementia special care must disclose the form of care or treatment provided that distinguishes it as being especially applicable or suitable for persons diagnosed with Alzheimer's, dementia or other disorders; authorizes the commissioner of health to promulgate necessary rules and regulations; provides for a five hundred dollar civil penalty for a violation.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to disclosure of special care offered to persons with Alzheimer's disease or dementia
